Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); 18TH DYNASTY ?; NEW KINGDOM (not after)
Name: Crouching scribe
Description: This figurine of schist belongs to a very classical iconography of egyptian statuary. Represented crouching, the scribe holds the roll of papyrus in the left hand and writes with the right hand. The specific form of the lower body and the pleated clothing are characteristics of Amarna art and could indicate that the piece dates to the period that followed the reign of Akhenaten.
